title: koakuma_(monster_company)
body: One of the “employees” in [[Monster Company]]. A little [[demon girl]] with an affinity for [[banana]]s.

title: sugar_cube
body:
A small cube of sugar, used to sweeten coffee or other hot beverages.

h4.See also

* [[granulated sugar]]
* [[sugar bowl]]
* [[sugar tongs]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: chocolate_marquise
body:
A rich [[chocolate]] [[dessert]] made with dark chocolate, [[butter]], [[granulated sugar|sugar]], cocoa powder, [[egg|eggs]] and cream.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: sugar_bowl
body: A small lidded [[bowl]] used for holding [[granulated sugar]] or [[sugar cube]]s. It is usually included as part of a [[tea set]]. If the sugar bowl has a matching [[spoon]], there may be a notch in the lid for the spoon to stick out of while the lid is closed.

title: eggnog
body:
A dairy beverage made of [[milk]], [[granulated sugar|sugar]] and beaten [[egg]]s. Alcohol such as brandy, rum or bourbon might be added, and is garnished with cinnamon or nutmeg. Popular around [[Christmas]].

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: sukiyaki
body:
A type of [[nabe]] dish, cooked over a direct fire at the table in a nabe hot pot.

Sukiyaki contains thinly-sliced [[beef]], green vegetables, [[mushroom]]s, [[tofu]], [[spring onion]], and (often) [[noodles]], in a [[soy sauce]], [[granulated sugar]], mirin, and [[sake]] cooking broth. It is usually served with raw [[egg]] for dipping.

Also known as [i]gyuunabe[/i] (beef nabe).

h4. See also

* [[Nabe]]
* [[Oden]]
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sukiyaki 
* "Pixpedia article (eng)":http://en.dic.pixiv.net/a/Sukiyaki
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: coffee
body:
A hot [[drink]] that is made by filtering hot water through ground [[coffee beans]], popular for its aroma and concentrated dose of caffeine. Use this tag when coffee itself (ordinarily a black or dark brown liquid) is visible in an image.

It is normally served in a porcelain [[coffee mug]], but it can be taken on the go in a stainless steel mug, styrofoam cup, or in a paper [[disposable coffee cup]]. For the traditional porcelain or ceramic "coffee cups" that aren't mug-shaped, see [[teacup]].

As coffee can be quite bitter, it is often served accompanied by [[granulated sugar|sugar]] and [[milk]] or [[cream]]. It is usually consumed while hot, but it may be served over ice.

title: shaving_cream
body:
Shaving cream is a type of cream that is used for [[shaving|shaving hair]]. It helps soften hair by providing lubrication. Types of shaving cream are aerosol cream (shaving foam), latherless cream(brushless), and lathering (brush) cream.

title: miramikaru_riran
body:
An original character for the [[Touhou]] voice drama あやつり異変 (Ayatsuri Ihen) that was made with Flipnote Gallery: World and popularized by [[manatsu_no_yo_no_inmu|Inmu]]/[[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆]] fans. The author [[Riina (cookie)|]] was in elementary school when she drew it and has since distanced herself from it. Today, Riran and [[miramikaru miran|her sister]] are mostly associated with Cookie☆.

A youkai [[fox girl|kitsune]] with the ability to drive people mad. Some jokes about her animation include drawing her with a red [[rice bowl]] or a purple seat belt or rod. She has [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]], [[red eyes]], [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrical]] [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]] and a [[single sidelock|sidelock]] on her left. She wears an [[open vest|open]] [[brown vest]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], a [[brown skirt]], and a [[black necktie]]. Her signature spell card is called Dark Inferno. 

Riran was first criticized for being an OC in a Touhou voice drama, but people began to draw her more as time went on. This was compounded by the release of [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]] which had both a [[Junko (touhou)|fox]] and a character that [[Clownpiece|drives people mad]]. Another coincidence was [[Senko_(sewayaki_kitsune_no_senko-san)|]] who happened to look similar. Since then, Riran has become the unofficial mascot of Cookie as an independent fandom outside of Touhou.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21049467

h4. External links

* "Nicopedia: メッモー☆":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/%E3%83%A1%E3%83%83%E3%83%A2%E3%83%BC%E2%98%86
* "Nicopedia: Miramikaru Riran":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/%E3%83%9F%E3%83%A9%E3%83%9F%E3%82%AB%E3%83%AB%E3%83%AA%E3%83%A9%E3%83%B3

title: geru_futota
body:
Voice of the [[Remilia Scarlet]] Cookie fundamentalist and Star Sapphire (as [[Shunga Youkyu]]) and Izayoi Sakuya (as [[Zwei (cookie)|]]) in [[Cookie (touhou)|Self-Contradiction☆]]. Her design was based on [[Hisaka (cookie)|]], but she wears a [[military uniform]] of a [[black hat]], [[black coat]], [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]], [[black necktie]], [[black skirt]], and an [[armband]] with a [[broken heart print]]. Her name is a corruption of the German "Toter Geruch", meaning "smell of death". 

Known to have Dissociative Personality Disorder and deleting her twitter and disappearing after stating her was going to commit suicide, but came back eventually before disappearing completely in 2021. Seems to actually genuinely hate everything about Cookie, going on multi-paragraph rants against the community, the actors, the directors, the doxxers, and the fan artists on 5ch and Discord.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21105757
other_names: げるっふとーたぁ姉貴

title: yamin_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Ibuki Suika]], [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and Cirno in the original [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆]]. Cirno has since been split off to become [[Cirno (cookie)]] and should be tagged separately. The only one of the original eight to also voice in later dramas, she avoided most of the controversy as she lived in a different part of Japan and sent her recordings over the internet. 

Although one of the main characters of the original voice drama, she later got grouped into the RIM family as the "child" character to [[Kanna (cookie)|]]'s "mother" attitude. Also seen with [[Manatsu no yo no inmu|Inmu]] characters far more than the rest of the cast. Sometimes drawn with a [[katana]] as a parody of Monster Hunter. A video of her in her room during a livestream tripping over a heater became memed.

Still active an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[Virtual YouTuber]] who collabs with Kanna. 

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21031393
* !asset #21031394
* !asset #21031395

* YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC52DXpy3Og_J05cpqLcQ2HQ
* Twitter: https://x.com/kurageyaming

title: jigen_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Alice Margatroid]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Kasu☆]]. Identifiable by her [[long bangs]] [[hair over eyes|over her eyes]] and [[holding gun|holding a gun]], usually a [[revolver]]. The most popular character from Kasu☆, later getting bundled into the ALC faction of characters, although she still sometimes appears with [[Koga (cookie)|]] and [[833 (cookie)|]] from their voice drama. She has completely disappeared from the internet.

Unlike other Cookie characters, her online handle isn't actually Jigen, it is Teresa. However, her frame of her with her hair over her eyes and her generally calm voice and demeanor in the voice drama led to people calling her Jigen after [[Jigen Daisuke]]. The gunslinger persona followed. She was paired with [[Ichigo (cookie)|]] as a variant of the "badass and naive" trope.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21075434

title: akira_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Yagokoro Eirin]] in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆]] and [[Kazami Yuuka]] in Kuso☆☆☆. More famous as Yuuka with [[messy hair]], [[large breasts]], no ascot, and [[sanpaku]]. An active voice actress and cosplayer, she maintains unusually good relations with the Cookie community and like dirty jokes. 

Because [[Macota (cookie)|]]'s Yuuka spoke fast to earn the nickname Fast Talking Oba-san, Akira's speed was even faster to earn her the nickname Super Fast Talking Oba-san. Her lines about Valentine's day is a popular copypasta. 
[code]あらアリスじゃないあなたもお買い物をしにこの店を訪れたの？この店で材料を買って、誰かに美味しいお菓子を作って贈ろうということねちなみにバレンタインデーとはかつての古代ローマの祭りを異教を認めないキリスト教圏内でも続けるためにヴァレンティヌスという架空の聖人を作り上げこれを悼むための日としたのが始まりと言われており今では恋人たちの日として世界各地で親しまれている。皆様はバレンタインデーを毎日いかがお過ごしですか

Oh my, if it isn't Alice. Did you come here to do shopping too? You wanted some ingredients so that you could make some sweets as a present for someone, right? Incidentally, Valentine of Valentine's Day was a fictional saint created so that those within the Christian circle who refused Paganism could continue the festivals of ancient Rome. It used to be a day of lament for Saint Valentine, but now it is more familiar known around the world as a day for lovers. Has everyone been spending their Valentine's Day well this year?[/code]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21073120
* !asset #21073121

title: nyon_(cookie)
body:
Voice of [[Nazrin]] and [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and artist in [[Atouda Ako (character)|]]'s [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆☆]], almost exclusively appearing as Nazrin. Atouda let her play Nazrin since the original voice was unavailable and Nazrin was Nyon's favorite Touhou character. Briefly was a [[virtual youtuber]] named [[Suzukiri Iro]] before retiring after the Cookie fans' attention was too much. Her unique voice and cute appearance skyrocketed her popularity.

Since she was the main person [[Ichigo (cookie)|]] interacted with during her most popular scene, Nyon became famous by association and also created a staggering amount of memes.
* "Nai desu": "Don't have it". Nazrin's response to Alice asking for ingredients (eggs, [[flour (cookie)|]], and [[milk (cookie)|]]) for baking. By far her most popular line, endlessly remixed and parodied. 
* "I also like Nazrin, Kogasa, and Nue. I like them all.": Her most famous line from a post-voice drama interview. She stressed the Nu in Nue, which became parodied as a very weird way of saying it. 
* NYN Bee and NYN Egg: In a [[bee costume]] and an [[egg costume]]. MAD material that became "canon" after the original artist of Nyon drew them. 
* [[Fake Nyon (cookie)|]]: An impersonator that achieved a decent level of fame. 
* Egg: To match Flour and Milk (and [[Butter (cookie)|]]). A taller, white skinned version of her drawn by her second artist. Sometimes treated as a separate character.
* "Atamawaruwaru": "Are you retarded?" A MAD material of her dancing set to the Honobono Shrine remix of Dichromatic Lotus Butterfly that went extremely viral
* "Anone, anone, [[crossbone_gundam|Crossbone]] will never be animated. I'd rather see [[gundam_hathaway's_flash|Hathaway's Flash]] animated than Crossbone.": Famous for both the first two words and the accurate prediction of Hathaway's Flash getting an adaptation in 2021 while Crossbone remains manga only.
* NYN Eevees: Drawing the [[eevee]]lutions as Nyons.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21074143
* !asset #22417574: Egg
* !asset #22417586: Rarely used, same artist as [[Akira (cookie)|]].

title: dressing
body:
The act of putting on clothes. 

Use this tag only when there is enough context within the image to definitely tell that the character is putting on clothes, not taking them off. If you are unsure whether clothes are being put on or taken off, use [[undressing]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Dressing another]]
* [[Undressing]]

body:

Use [[unworn clothes]] and [[clothes in front]] instead where applicable.

title: open-toe_shoes
body:
[[Shoes]] that leave the toes uncovered.

Not to be confused with [[sandals]], which leave the toes uncovered by default. Sandals leave most of the foot uncovered, aside from the straps holding them onto the foot, while open-toe shoes cover the top or sides of the foot, leaving only the toes uncovered.

title: kain_r_heinlein
body:
The main villain of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]]. 

Following a poor upbringing alongside his brother [[Grant (SNK)|Abel, a.k.a. Grant]], and sister Marie, Kain swore to gain power at all costs. After the death of South Town's infamous crime lord [[Geese Howard]], Kain would ultimately gain power and take his place as the ruler of South Town's underworld. To prove his might, he hosted the latest edition of South Town's legendary King of Fighters martial arts tournament - The King of Fighters: Maximum Mayhem. He claims to be the uncle of [[Rock Howard]], as his sister Marie was a lover of Geese's. Though Rock long believed his mother Marie was dead, Kain claims she is indeed alive, convincing Rock to work with him for a time.

Kain returns in [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], with [[Vox Reaper]] taking Grant's place as his new enforcer.
other_names: カイン・R・ハインライン

title: akatsuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Akatsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[purple hair]] that can be fairly [[messy_hair|messy]], and usually has a tuft of [[hair_between_eyes|hair between her eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Special-Type's [[serafuku]] ([[white shirt]], [[black sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]]), but with [[black pantyhose]], a [[flat cap]], and the "III" badge on the left side of her collar.

She does her best to act like a true lady and thus doesn't like to be [[age_conscious|treated as a child]], especially in regards to [[headpat]]ting. Her protests that she is a "full-fledged lady" or "first-class lady" have become something of a catchphrase: [[ichininmae no lady]]. This has the side effect of making her look even more childish. Many characters enjoy teasing her by doing things that play upon her being childish, such as giving her [[okosama_lunch|children's meals]].

title: atlanta_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of USS [i]Atlanta[/i] (CL-51) of the United States Navy. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]].

She is tall with [[large breasts]], and has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[two side up]] hairstyle and [[grey eyes]]. She wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[garrison cap]] with the number 51 written on it, silver [[star earrings]], an [[anchor hair ornament]], a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] that reaches her thighs, a [[high-waist_skirt|high-waisted]] [[black skirt|black]] [[suspender skirt]] over it that also reaches her upper thighs. [[Garter straps]] are visible below her skirt, attached to two [[thigh strap]]s. She also wears [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder_footwear|rudder]] [[boots]], and [[white gloves|white]] [[partially fingerless gloves]] which expose only her thumb and index finger and cover the other fingers in a mitten-style. Her [[machinery]] includes four [[ship turret|turret]]s and a [[crane_(machine)|]].

She is cool, laid back, and even somewhat aloof and/or easily irritated, in contrast to many of the American shipgirls who came before her. She has a particular aversion to night battles and Japanese destroyers, [[Akatsuki (kancolle)|]] and [[Yuudachi (kancolle)|]] in particular, in reference to her historical fate. She is often compared to [[Ryuujou (kancolle)|]], who also has brown hair and a similar haircut but a flat chest.

The historical [i]Atlanta[/i] was heavily damaged after sinking Japanese destroyer [[akatsuki (kancolle)|Akatsuki]] during the Naval Battle of Guadalcanal. She was sunk on her captain's orders later on the same day.

h4. Appearance

title: roma_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian battleship [i]Roma[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)]], voiced by [[Kuno Misaki]].

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], and [[brown eyes]] with [[pince-nez]] [[glasses]]. 

Her default outfit is similar to her sister [[Littorio (Kancolle)|]]: a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with additional [[detached sleeves]] and a [[white capelet]], [[grey corset]], [[red skirt]], [[white thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]] and red horizontal stripes, [[white hat|white]] [[headdress]], and grey-green [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] is a split hull with the [[Regia Marina]]'s historic red-white bow stripes, her three 381 mm triple gun mounts, and additional [[anti-aircraft gun]]s at kai form.

Historically, [i]Roma[/i] was sunk by the [[Luftwaffe]] as she, her sister-ships and other units in the Italian fleet attempted to sail to Malta to surrender to the British. Because of her real-life counterpart's fate, she is often portrayed as having a grudge toward German ship girls.

title: maestrale_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian destroyer [i]Maestrale[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)|]], voiced by [[Kitou Akari]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]], [[green eyes]], and a [[tan]] skin with visible [[tanlines]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[sleeveless]] [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with her real-life hull code, striped [[red neckerchief]] with an [[anchor]] clip, [[striped panties]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and propellers to her back, connecting her two 53.3 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] and 120 mm twin gun mounts, [[paravane]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, and her real-life fire control director as a [[mini hat]]. Her kai form includes a third 120 mm single gun mount on the funnel.

title: grecale_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian destroyer [i]Grecale[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)|]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]], [[green eyes]], and [[tan|uniformly tanned skin]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[sleeveless]] [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with her real-life hull code, striped [[red neckerchief]] with an [[anchor]] clip, and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast to her back, connecting her two 53.3 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] and 120 mm twin gun mounts, [[paravane]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, and her real-life fire control director as a [[mini hat]]. As she was the only one of the class that survived to the Armistice (and the war), she also has additional 20 and 37 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on her funnel rig at kai form. 

Her personality is one of a [[mesugaki]]-type: flirty and teasing. She is the only one of her class who survived the war, reflecting in her high luck and evasion stats.

title: bernadette_rostenkowski-wolowitz
body: Dr. Bernadette Maryann Rostenkowski-Wolowitz, (née Rostenkowski), is a main character in [[The Big Bang Theory]]. She was a waitress at The Cheesecake Factory and has earned her Ph.D. in microbiology who has a lucrative job at the pharmaceutical company ZanGen.

title: dc_extended_universe
body:
The DC Extended Universe (shortened as the DCEU) was an American media franchise and shared universe centered on a series of superhero films and television series produced by DC Films and distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures. It is based on characters that appear in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]].
A new rebooted franchise of films and television series, the [[DC Universe (franchise)|DC Universe]] (DCU), is planned by James Gunn and Peter Safran, who were appointed co-chairmen and co-CEOs of DC Studios in a late-2022 restructuring. Certain DCEU characters, such as Peacemaker, Amanda Waller, and Blue Beetle, will be moved to the DCU, while the second season of Peacemaker will take place in the new universe.
h4. DCEU Movies In Order

* [[Man of Steel]] (2013)
* [[Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice]] (2016)
* [[Suicide Squad]] (2016)
* [[Wonder Woman (movie)|]] (2017)
* [[Justice League (movie)|]] (2017) / Zack Snyder's Justice League (2021)
* [[Aquaman (movie)|]] (2018)
* [[Shazam! (movie)|Shazam!]] (2019)
* [[Birds of Prey (movie)|]] (2020)
* [[Wonder Woman 1984]] (2020)
* [[The Suicide Squad (2021 Movie)|]] (2021)
* [[Black Adam (movie)|]] (2022)
* [[Shazam! Fury of the Gods]] (2023)
* [[The Flash (movie)|]] (2023)
* [[Blue Beetle (2023)|]] (2023)
* Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom (2023)

h4. TV Series

* [[Peacemaker (HBO Max)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]]
* [[X-Men film series]]

title: dc_universe_(franchise)
body: The DC Universe (DCU) is an American media franchise and shared universe based on characters from DC Comics publications. It was created by James Gunn and Peter Safran, co-chairmen and co-CEOs of DC Studios. The DCU is a soft reboot of a previous franchise, the [[DC Extended Universe]] (DCEU), retaining select cast members and narrative elements but disregarding others. In contrast with the previous state of DC Comics adaptations, the DCU features a united continuity and story across live-action films and television, animation, and video games. Concurrent DC adaptations that do not fit this continuity are labeled "DC Elseworlds".

title: sam_wilson
body: Samuel Thomas "Sam" Wilson is a superhero appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. The character was introduced by writer-editor Stan Lee and artist Gene Colan in [[Captain America]] #117 (Sept. 1969).

title: nisshin_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese seaplane tender [i]Nisshin[/i]. Character design by [[Bob (biyonbiyon)|Bob]], voiced by [[Miyamoto Yume]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] tied in a [[high ponytail]] and [[hair_tie|hair ties]], [[thick eyebrows]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is a [[miko]] attire: with a white [[kariginu|suikan]] over a red kosode and a slitted [[red hakama]], [[white socks|white]] [[tabi]], and [[okobo]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life hull split in half at her back and containing her 14 cm twin gun mounts, a [[flight deck]] apron, and her real-life rangefinder as a [[hair ornament]]. 

Her antiquated costume and demeanor belies the fact that she is the most advanced and the most powerful seaplane tender in the game, functioning more like a light cruiser with too many planes, having the ability to equip cruiser guns and mini-submarines.

title: riot_shield
body:
A modern [b][[shield]][/b] used by [[police]] and some [[military|armed forces]] in riot control to protect the shield carrier from melee attacks and also thrown projectiles, or non-lethal weapons such as rubber bullets and water cannons.
Riot shields are typically made out of transparent polycarbonate and are designed to be shatter resistant, but are generally not ballistic resistant.

Riot shields can either come in two main variants, one that is one-handed that affords less protection but allows the user to use the other arm, generally to wield a baton. It has two handles, the left-most of which is held on to while the other keeps the arm in place. And another that requires both arms and provides full protection.

[b]Not to be confused[/b] with [[ballistic shield]] which is identifiable by its opaque, often metallic appearance and with narrow viewing port.

h4. Correct example
* !post #6195921

h4. Incorrect example
* !post #6308441: [[Ballistic Shield]]

h4. See also

* [[List of armor]]
* [[Rioting]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Riot shield":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riot_shield]

title: boom_microphone
body:
A boom microphone is a general term for any type of [[microphone]] attached to a boom pole, which is either carried or fixed to a heavy stand. Boom mics are popular in the entertainment world because they can capture audio from outside a camera frame without sacrificing quality.

Not to be confused with [[studio microphone]] or any [[desk microphone|desk-mounted microphones]], because [[boom microphone]]s are connected to a much longer pole and generally only seen in a film-making context.

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: desk_microphone
body: A [[desk]]-mounted [[microphone]]

title: microphone
body:
A recording device that is either held by the hands, a metal stand, or simply worn using a [[headset]]. It is used for singing or speaking into, and when the user is using a microphone their voice is amplified by a [[speaker]]. Also includes the microphones used by camera crews to pick up sound.

h4. Types
* [[Shure 55SH]] (1939)
* [[Shure SM58]] (1966)

h4. See also

* [[boom microphone]]
* [[idol]]
* [[singing]]
* [[karaoke]]
* [[desk microphone]]
* [[lavalier microphone]]
* [[microphone stand]]
* [[pretend microphone]]
* [[studio microphone]]
* [[vintage microphone]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: gekota
body:
Gekota is a popular franchise of anthropomorphic frogs found in merchandise marketed to children in the [[ToAru Majutsu no Index]] universe. [[Misaka Mikoto]] is a huge fan of the franchise, which - much to her consternation - gets her labeled as childish. Other Gekota fans (gekoers / ゲコラー) include [[Hokaze Junko]] and [[Iizumi Rita]].

h5. Known characters: 
* [[Gekota (character)]]. He is colored in green, has a [[black facial hair|black]] [[mustache]] and wears a [[black suit]]. He is an old man type of character who is known to suffer from motion sickness easily. Because he has a habit of saying geko-geko (ゲコ, ゲコ), the name stuck and he's been referred to as such ever since.
* [[Keroyon (ToAru)|]] (ケロヨン). Also green, but doesn't wear anything. Has [[:>]] expression. He lives next to Gekota.
* [[Pyonkichi (ToAru)|]] (ピョン吉). Is red colored. Doesn't wear anything.
* [[Pyonko]] (ピョン子, Yen Press: Hoppit). She is pink colored and often seen with a [[red bow]] [[head bow|on her head]].

title: pretend_microphone
body: When someone holding something that's not an actual [[microphone]] while pretending that it is.

title: minea_(dq4)
body:
A character in [[Dragon Quest IV]]. Also known as Nara, Mina, or Meena. She has [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]].

When not drawn with her standard costume, she can easily be confused with her [[sisters|sister]] [[Manya (dq4)|]]. The difference is that Manya has [[parted bangs]] while Minea has [[hair intakes]]. See post #3966825; Minea is on the left and Manya is on the right. Despite their appearances, they are not twins as Manya is 21 and Minea, 18.

h4. External links

* "Dragon Quest Wiki: Meena":[https://dragonquest.fandom.com/wiki/Meena]

body:
The feeling of lust when a character hurts themselves or is hurt by another character.

Use this tag only when there is a clear indication, such as dialogue or facial expression, that the character is enjoying or requesting the action. Do not use for other posts depicting [[bdsm]].

The term was coined by the psychiatrist "Richard von Krafft-Ebing":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_von_Krafft-Ebing], who derived the term from the name of the author "Leopold von Sacher-Masoch":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leopold_von_Sacher-Masoch], whose works featured this sexual practice frequently. 

h6. Example Acts
* [[insult]]ing
* [[strangling]]
* [[whipping]]
* [[spanking]]
* [[human furniture]]
* [[stepped on]]
* [[hitting]]
* [[body writing]]
* [[cbt|cock and ball torture]]

h6. Notable Characters

title: arcturus
body:
Korean RPG released in 2000. Developed by Gravity and Sonnori, published by Wizard Soft in Korea and Nihon [[Falcom]] in Japan. The full title is Arcturus: The Curse and Loss of Divinity, but the shorter name is more common. The game was planned for an English translation in 2001 but was cancelled, eventually being translated by a fan in "2017":[https://www.romhacking.net/forum/index.php?topic=23958.0]. The game engine would become the basis for Gravity's next game, [[Ragnarok Online]].

title: rosenkreuzstilette
body:
Rosenkreuzstilette is a doujin soft game created by the indie company [erka:es]. It's known for being similar in game mechanics to the [[Mega Man (series)|]] series and also borrows elements from the [[Castlevania (series)|]] series. It contains nods to the Order of the Rose-Cross and is a polar opposite of the Mega Man series, with female Magi as opposed to the male Robot Masters and magical, serene and beautiful settings with a comical German horror theme as opposed to Mega Man's futuristic setting with a comical robot theme.

h4.See also

* [[Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel]]

title: the_amazing_spider-man
body:
A 2012 film based on the [[Spider-Man (series)|]] comics, and the first to feature [[Andrew Garfield]] as [[Peter Parker]]/[[Spider-Man]]. The film served as a reboot in a new continuity separate from Sam Raimi's previous trilogy.

While "The Amazing Spider-Man" is a common title for the mainline Spider-Man comic run and the series in general, this tag is for the 2012 film only. See [[Spider-Man (series)]] for the series as a whole.

Followed by [[The Amazing Spider-Man 2]], released in 2014.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: The Amazing Spider-Man (film)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Amazing_Spider-Man_(film)
other_names: アメイジング・スパイダーマン

title: spider-man_3
body:
The third and final installment of Sam Raimi's trilogy of live-action Spider-Man films. Releasing in 2007 after [[Spider-Man 2]], starring [[Tobey Maguire]] as [[Peter Parker]]/[[Spider-Man]], alongside Kirsten Dunst, James Franco, Thomas Haden Church, Topher Grace, and Bryce Dallas Howard. 

A fourth installment, titled Spider-Man 4, was set to be released on May 6, 2011, followed by a Venom spin-off film, along with a fifth and sixth installment, but all were canceled. The Spider-Man film series was rebooted twice; first with [[The Amazing Spider-Man]] (2012) starring [[Andrew Garfield]]; and later a new film series set within the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU) starring [[Tom Holland]].

h4. See also
* [[Bully Maguire (Meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Spider-Man 3":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man_3

title: spider-man_2
body:
The second installment of Sam Raimi's trilogy of live-action [[Spider-Man (series)|]] films. Releasing in 2004 after [[Spider-Man 1 (2002)|Spider-Man]], starring [[Tobey Maguire]] as [[Peter Parker]]/[[Spider-Man]], alongside Kirsten Dunst, James Franco, Alfred Molina, Rosemary Harris, and Donna Murphy. Set two years after the events of Spider-Man, the film finds Peter Parker struggling to stop scientist Dr. [[Otto Octavius]] from recreating the dangerous experiment that killed his wife and left him neurologically fused to mechanical tentacles, while also dealing with an existential crisis between his dual identities that appears to be stripping him of his powers. Followed by [[Spider-Man 3]].
h4. See also
* [[Pizza Time (Meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Spider-Man 2":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man_2

title: spider-man_1_(2002)
body:
The first installment of Sam Raimi's trilogy of live-action [[Spider-Man (series)|]] films, Releasing in 2002, starring [[Tobey Maguire]] as [[Peter Parker]]/[[Spider-Man]] and [[Willem Dafoe]] as the [[Green Goblin]]. The film was notably one of the first financially and critically successful superhero films for [[Marvel]], and arguably set off the trend for superhero movies in the early 2000s. 
Many scenes and lines from the movie have been parodied many times since release and become the subject of [[meme]]s, including [[Peter Parker's Glasses (meme)|]] and the iconic [[upside-down kiss]] in the rain between [[Spider-Man]] and [[Mary Jane Watson]].

Followed by [[Spider-Man 2]], released in 2004.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Spider-Man (2002 film)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man_(2002_film)

title: akitsushima_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese seaplane tender [i]Akitsushima[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Komatsu Mikako]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair|purple]]-[[grey hair]] tied into a [[side ponytail]] to her left with an [[ahoge]] on top, and [[purple eyes]]. She also has a very long [[hair ribbon]] on her right with two dangling [[anchor]]s. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey hat|grey]] [[mini hat]] patterned off her real-life bow, a [[military uniform]] with black trim that includes a double-breasted [[jacket]], [[black armband]] with her real-life [[radar]] set, [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], single [[thigh strap]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a hull piece with her real-life camouflage pattern, a large [[crane (machine)|]], a 12.7 cm twin gun mount, and a 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount.

Her "familiar" is [[Nishikitaitei-chan]], a [[flying boat]] nearly as large as herself that has a [[Rensouhou-chan]]-like face on its left side that she carries with her.

title: shigure_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Shigure[/i]. Designed by [[Kujou Ichiso]], voiced by [[Tanibe Yumi]].

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown_hair|dark brown]]/[[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]] in a [[braid]] over her [[hair_over_shoulder|shoulder]] as well as [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Shiratsuyu[/i]-class' [[school uniform]]: a [[black_serafuku|black]] [[serafuku]], [[black socks]], and brown [[loafers]].

Her [[rigging]] at base form consists of her 12.7 cm twin gun mount to her back and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s.

Because of her quiet tone of voice, somewhat sad eyes, extreme fondness when referring to [[Fusou (kancolle)|Fusou]] and [[Yamashiro (kancolle)|Yamashiro]], and provoking taunts when damaged, there's a fan theory floating around the internet that believes Shigure suffers from PTSD from being the sole survivor of the Nishimura Fleet after the Battle of Surigao Strait.

She was the protagonist of the second season of the [[Kantai Collection (anime)|Kantai Collection anime]].

title: mutsuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Mutsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Kusada Souta]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair|brown]]/[[red hair]] with a slight [[gradient hair|gradient]] (appearing brown up top and a brighter red at the bottom), and [[red eyes]]. She and her sister [[Kisaragi (kancolle)|]] wear a white version of the class' uniform: a [[white shirt]] with [[green sailor collar]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast on her back, a 12 cm single [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

She is a hyperactive and upbeat girl. She had a starring role in the [[Kantai Collection (anime)|Kantai Collection anime]] and notably had a friendship with [[Fubuki (kancolle)|]] and [[Yuudachi (kancolle)|]], as well as a possibly more serious relationship with her younger sister [[Kisaragi (kancolle)|]].

title: taiyou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort carrier [i]Taiyou[/i]. The remodeled form of [[Kasuga Maru (Kancolle)|]]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]]. 

As Taiyou (but not Taiyou Kai), she is visually nearly identical to her unremodeled form, and has [[long_hair|long]] dark [[brown hair]] in a [[folded ponytail]] held in place with a [[blue_ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]], and [[swept bangs]].  She has [[brown_eyes|brown]] [[tareme]]-style eyes.  Similar to [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu's]] [[akagi (kancolle)|fleet]] [[kaga (kancolle)|carriers]], Kasuga Maru wears a white [[dougi]] top with a red [[hakama short skirt]], and [[black socks]].  On her left hand, she wears a thick falconry [[gloves|glove]].  Following further remodeling, she wears an olive dougi with a green hakama skirt, and in Kai-Ni, she wears a grey [[scarf]].

Her [[machinery|rigging]] involves a [[flight deck]] strapped to her right arm, falconry-related steel cases strapped to her torso, and steel [[platform boots]].  In [[Taiyou Kai Ni (kancolle)|her Kai-Ni form]], she also wears [[headphones]] with a radio tower on the right side, and her flight deck has a [[camouflage]] pattern.

Her name means "goshawk", which was a prized bird of prey among the Edo-era Samurai class.

title: abukuma_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Abukuma[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Nomizu Iori]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] in an elaborate hairstyle featuring [[double bun]] and [[hair rings]] reminiscent of [[Tsukino Usagi]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her base outfit is shared with her sisters Kinu and Yura: a buttoned [[white shirt]] with light [[green sailor collar]], light [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[black boots|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of four 14 cm single gun mounts (two on her wrists, two on her rig), held by a funnel piece to her back. 

She is a somewhat high-strung and self-conscious girl. She tends to fuss over her hair excessively, apparently as a joke about how her bow was destroyed in a collision with [[Kitakami (Kancolle)|]]. Kitakami is portrayed as having a teasing/dominant relationship with Abukuma because of this (see pool #7431).

title: mighty_strike_freedom_gundam
body:
[b]ZGMF/A-262PD-P Mighty Strike Freedom Gundam [/b]
Appearing in [[Gundam SEED Freedom]], it is the combined form of the upgraded [[Strike Freedom Gundam]] Type II (piloted by [[Kira Yamato]]) and the new Proud Defender support unit (piloted by [[Lacus Clyne]]). 

While the Mighty Strike Freedom loses its Super [[funnels (Gundam)|DRAGOON]] & [I]Wings of the Skies[/I] backpack during the combining process, it is instead gains access to 2 new systems: a defensive one that allows it to generate a protective energy field, and an offensive one that unleashes a wide-scale EMP that can shut down enemy targets and destroy projectiles within a large area around it.

The Mighty Strike Freedom also has full access to its [[v-fin]]-mounted "Disruptor" [[beam cannon]] unlike its base Type II form due to its power requirements. It is also equipped with a "Futsunomitama" solid [[katana]].
other_names: マイティーストライクフリーダムガンダム

title: destiny_gundam_spec_ii
body:
[b]ZGMF/A-42S2 Destiny Gundam Spec II [/b]

Upgraded version of the [[Destiny Gundam]] that appears in [[Gundam SEED Freedom]] movie. [[Shinn Asuka]] remains as its pilot. 

It mostly resembles the original Destiny except that the Spec II's color scheme is darker, the light blue colors on the original's chest as well as the color of its "Arondight" anti-ship sword are both replaced with white, and the v-fin is now grey-colored instead of yellow. The new color scheme is quite similar to that of the [[Legend Gundam]], which is piloted by the late [[Rey Za Burrel]]. In-universe, this is Shinn's tribute to his fallen friend and comrade. 

The Destiny Spec II retains the original's weapons though its systems gained several upgrades. It has improved Variable Phase Shift Armor (which is the reason of its modified color scheme), it is now equipped with Deuterion Beam Energy Transfer System for recharging battery-powered mobile suits which are equipped with a Deuterion Beam receiver such as the Impulse Gundam Spec II, and its signature [I]Wings of Light[/I] is also enhanced. It is now capable of producing more realistic, clone-like afterimages that is also more abundant in quantity than the original, enabling the Destiny Spec II to cause greater confusion to its enemies in combat. 

Additionally, the Destiny Gundam Spec II has a new inner frame capable of improved performance, which glows red at maximum power output.
other_names: デスティニーガンダムSpecII

title: z'gok_(seed)
body:
[b]ZGMF-MM07 Z'Gok [/b]
Piloted by [[Athrun Zala]], it is Cosmic Era's incarnation of the [[Z'Gok]] [[mobile suit]] from Universal Century, appearing in [[Gundam SEED Freedom]]. [spoilers]It is actually the disguised form of his upgraded [[Infinite Justice Gundam Type II]].[/spoilers]

title: infinite_justice_gundam_type_ii
body:
[b]ZGMF-X191M2 Infinite Justice Gundam Type II[/b]
An upgraded version of [[Infinite Justice Gundam]] that appears in [[Gundam SEED Freedom]]. [[Athrun Zala]] remains as its pilot. [spoilers]Also initially disguised as the [[Z'Gok (SEED)|]], which is Cosmic Era's incarnation of its [[Z'Gok|namesake]] [[mobile suit]] from Universal Century.[/spoilers]

The Type II is equipped with a new 4-winged sub-flight lifter backpack (which resembles the [[X-Wing]] from [[Star Wars]]) with improved firepower, including additional [[energy sword]] emitters and missile launchers. Its signature long mohawk sensor is also equipped with a [[energy blade|beam blade]] emitter as its hidden weapon.
other_names: インフィニットジャスティスガンダム弐式

title: rising_freedom_gundam
body:
[b]STTS-909 Rising Freedom Gundam[/b]
[[Kira Yamato]]'s [[mobile suit]] in [[Gundam SEED Freedom]] movie. 

It is equipped with a pair of hip-mounted [[railgun|railguns]] and a pair of wing-mounted [[beam cannon|beam cannons]], bringing back the original [[Freedom Gundam]]'s version of the [I]Full Burst Mode[/I] loadout. However, it is not equipped with the version of the [[Strike Freedom Gundam]]'s [[funnels (Gundam)|DRAGOON System]] nor its Voiture Lumiere System/[I][[energy wings|Wings of the Skies]][/I]. It also transforms into a a fighter-like form, making it the first time that Kira pilots a transformable mobile suit.
other_names: ライジングフリーダムガンダム
ライジングフリーダム

title: immortal_justice_gundam
body:
[b]STTS-808 Immortal Justice Gundam[/b]
A [[mobile suit]] in [[Gundam SEED Freedom]] movie. Piloted by [[Shinn Asuka]].

Unlike the  original [[Justice Gundam]], this unit doesn't possess the combination backpack/flight system unique to the original. However, it is also equipped with a pair of [[leg blade|shin-mounted]] [[energy blade|beam blades]] which are the signature weapons of the [[Infinite Justice Gundam]]. Like its sibling unit, the [[Rising Freedom Gundam]], it is also capable of transforming into a fighter-like form.

title: soyombo
body:
The Soyombo symbol is a special character in the Soyombo alphabet invented by Öndör Gegeen Zanabazar (the first Gelupa of Tibetean [[Buddhism]] in Mongolia) in 1686. The name "Soyombo" is derived from Sanskrit svayambhu "self-created". It serves as a national symbol of [[Mongolia]], to be found on the Flag of Mongolia, the Emblem of Mongolia, and on many other official documents.

The Soyombo may only feature the upper parts in some variation, seen for example in the flag of Agin-Buryat Okrug. 

H4.   𑪞  𑪟  𑪠

title: michael_wittmann
body:
[b]Michael Wittmann[/b] (22 April 1914 – 8 August 1944), also known as [b]The Black Baron[/b], was a notorious and infamous German [[Waffen-SS]] [[tank]] commander and [[Tiger I]] ace from [[World War II]] with 139 confirmed kills.

He died in [[France]] during the 1944 [[Invasion of Normandy]] when his tank was [[ambush]]ed, hit and destroyed by a combined Allied armored force.

title: takamaki_anne
body:
[[Persona 5]] character. Voiced by [[Mizuki Nana]] (JP) / [[Erika Harlacher]] (EN).

A 16-year-old, quarter-American girl who attends Shujin High School. Unable to fit in with those around her due to her noticeably different appearance, she isolates herself within the school. She is often seen hanging out with the [[amamiya ren|protagonist]] and [[Sakamoto Ryuuji]]. Strange rumors about her have seemingly been circulating the school, but whether or not they’re true is currently unknown. Her initial persona is [[Carmen (Persona 5)|]].

title: sweet_lolita
body:
Sweet Lolita or "Amaloli" ( アマーロリ ) is heavily influenced by Rococo styles as well as Victorian and Edwardian children's clothing. Focusing on the child and fantasy aspects of Lolita, the Sweet Lolita style adopts the basic Lolita format and uses lighter colors.

It has all the traditional Lolita elements but with a wider choice of colors, like light pinks, baby blues, whites, and even sometimes colors like lavender, canary yellow and mint green. This is also where you'll find the most fluff and frill.

[b]excerpts from Wikipedia & Lolita Handbook[/b]

h4. See also

* [[Lolita Fashion]]
* [[Gothic Lolita]]
* [[Wa Lolita]]
* [[Tag group:Fashion style]]

title: classic_lolita
body:
A style of [[Lolita fashion]] heavily based on historical fashion. It tends to have a "mature/elegant" [[Victorian]] look to it.

Skirts in Classic Lolita are usually longer than in Sweet Lolita, and feature motifs such as [[floral print]], crowns, realistic animals, and fine art. Overall, the style tends to have a more sophisticated appearance.

h4. See also
* [[Tag group:Fashion style]]

title: gothic_lolita
body:
Gothic Lolita (ゴスロリ, "GothLoli", or sometimes "Loli-Goth") is a specific kind of fashion that is a mixture of both [[goth fashion]] and [[Lolita fashion|Lolita styles]]. [[Lolita fashion]] draws much of its inspiration from Rococo, Victorian-style and Edwardian fashion and often aims to imitate the look of Victorian children or porcelain dolls. Gothic Lolita applies the aesthetics of [[goth fashion]] to the childlike, pretty [[Lolita fashion]].

h4. See also

* [[Goth fashion]]
* [[Lolita fashion]]
* [[Tag group:Fashion style]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Gothic Lolita":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gothic_Lolita

title: arm_garter
body:
An elastic band worn around the upper arm. Originally, this was to allow for adjusting a sleeves length to better fit the wearer, or to hold up very long gloves that have a loose fit around the arm, but they have since become a decorative band on their own.

On Danbooru, arm garters usually look like [[frilled thigh strap]] but are worn like an [[armband]], and are not used to hold up a sleeve.  If they're worn over sleeves, then use the [[sleeve garter]] tag.

h4. Example

Not to be confused with [[plaid]].

body:

Its distinctive features have made it the iconic toadstool in popular culture, notably as the inspiration for [[power-up|power-up]]s in the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]]. It is a known hallucinogen but can be made edible by boiling.

title: fat_pikachu
body:
A [[Pikachu]] as depicted with its original, plumper proportions. Described by original designer [[Nishida Atsuko]] as "dumpling-shaped", with the defining trait being the lack of a clear separation point between the head and the rest of the body.

[[Gigantamax Pikachu]] is based on this version. Sometimes also depicted with a white (or darker yellow) belly and a tail similar to [[Raichu]]'s - this design is based on its sprite from [[Pokemon RGBY|Pokémon Red & Green]].

title: batman_(1966)
body: Batman is an American live-action television series based on the [[DC Comics]] character of the same name. It stars [[Adam West]] as [[Bruce Wayne]]/[[Batman]] and Burt Ward as [[Dick Grayson]]/Robin—two crime-fighting heroes who defend Gotham City from a variety of archvillains. It is known for its camp style and upbeat theme music, as well as its intentionally humorous, simplistic morality aimed at its preteen audience.

title: leonard_mccoy
body:
Character from [[Star Trek: The Original Series]] and [i]Star Trek: The Animated Series[/i], played by [[DeForest Kelley]].

The chief surgeon of the [[USS Enterprise]], known for his quick temper (Especially when he is dealing with [[Spock]]) and no-nonsense demeanor. His signature phrase, "I'm a doctor, not a X!", has attained longtime [[meme]]tic status in the Western science fiction fandom.

A decade after Kelley's death, [[Karl Urban]] assumed the role of McCoy in the [[star trek (2009)|Star Trek reboot film]] in 2009.

title: gat_(hat)
body:
A gat, also called a heuklip [tn](lit. [i]black hat[/i])[/tn], is a type of Korean traditional hat; until the 19th century, it was worn only by noblemen. They are cylindrical in shape with a wide brim (양태) on a bamboo frame (모자). Compare to the Western [[top hat]].

Though most gat are black, some variations exist. White gat were exclusively for funerals. Red gat were worn by military officials.

The dangling accessory is called gatkuen.

A variant made from bamboo is called the [[paeraengi]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7207891

h4. See also

* [[Korean clothes]]

title: adhesive_bra
body:
A [[bra]] or [[bikini]] top that has no shoulder straps or side bands, instead being held on only by adhesive. Also called a sticky bra, stick-on bra, or a NuBra, after the original brand name.

In real life, adhesive bras are designed to be worn with [[strapless]], [[backless dress]]es. In fanart, they're more often worn by themselves or as part of a [[revealing clothes|revealing outfit]].

h4. Examples

* !post #384968
* !post #2855858
* !post #5123745

title: chained_sarkaz_girl
body:
An unnamed Sarkaz girl from the second [[Arknights]] Integrated Strategies, "Crimson Solitaire", or just "IS2". She also makes a cameo in IS5.

She first appears in the encounter node "Shackled Bloodline" that triggers a battle, similar to those of:

* An unidentified Cautus's encounter node "Damsel in Distress" in IS1, [i]Ceobe's Fungimist[/i].
* [[Dancing Sarkaz Lady]]'s encounter node "Dancing Chests" in IS3, [i]Mizuki & Caerula Arbor[/i].
* [[Qalaisa (arknights)|Basket Sarkaz Lady]]'s encounter node "Northwind Witch" from IS4, [i]Expeditioner's Jǫklumarkar[/i].
* [[Praying Sankta Nun (arknights)|]]'s encounter node "The Pious Worshiper" from IS5, [i]Sarkaz's Furnaceside Fables[/i].

Typically has [[red eyes]] [u][[eyes visible through hair|visible through]][/u] [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], which are tied in [u][[twintails]][/u], and [u][[black earrings]][/u] on her [[pointy ears]]. She wears a [u][[short dress|short]][/u] [[see-through dress|see-through]] [[black dress]] with a [u][[floral print]][/u], a [u][[black ascot]][/u] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs|kneehigh socks]]. [u]Both her dress and legwear are [[asymmetrical clothes|asymmetrical]][/u]: the see-trough part of the dress continues as a sleeve on her left arm with multiple [[arm strap]]s, while her right one is [[single bare arm|bare]]. Her right leg is covered by the see-through cloth as a [[single pantsleg]], while her left one is [[single_bare_leg |bare]] with two [[thigh strap]]s.
Her [[black horns|black]] [[demon horns]] are [u]curvier at the base[/u] and she is often depicted with [u][[cuffs]] chained a [[pillar]][/u].
[tn]To avoid misidentification with IS3's Dancing Sarkaz Ladt, the Chained Girl's distinguished features have been underlined.[/tn]
other_names: 束縛された血族(アークナイツ)

title: praying_sankta_nun_(arknights)
body:
An unnamed Sankta nun from the fifth [[Arknights]] Integrated Strategies, [i]Sarkaz's Furnaceside Fables[/i], or just "IS5".

She first appears in the encounter node "The Pious Worshiper" that triggers a battle, similar to those of:

* An unidentified Cautus's encounter node "Damsel in Distress" in IS1, [i]Ceobe's Fungimist[/i].
* [[Chained Sarkaz Girl]]'s encounter node "Shackled Bloodline" in IS2, [i]Crimson Solitaire[/i].
* [[Dancing Sarkaz Lady]]'s encounter node "Dancing Chests" in IS3, [i]Mizuki & Caerula Arbor[/i].
* [[Qalaisa (arknights)|Basket Sarkaz Lady]]'s encounter node "Northwind Witch" from IS4, [i]Expeditioner's Jǫklumarkar[/i].

Typically has [[gradient hair]] from [[grey hair|grey]] to [[white hair|white]] with [[hair intakes|intakes]], covered by a [[see-through veil|see-through]] [[black veil]], with a [[white halo]] and [[glowing wings|glowing]] [[detached wings]]. She wears a [[black capelet]], [[lace-trimmed thighhighs|lace-trimmed]] [[white thighhighs]] with [[frilled thighhighs|frills]] and a [[long dress|long]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[black dress]] with a [[pelvic curtain]], held by [[yellow belt|yellow]] [[chain belt]] and a [[black belt|black]] [[chest belt]]. Finally, she can be see [[holding rosary|holding]] a [[rosary]] with her [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]].

title: 16personalities
body:
A website that offers personality tests based on the [[Myers-Briggs Type Indicator]] model.

They have color-coded designs for every personality type, which are then often used as bases for character creation by artists.
If a character based on an MBTI type doesn't take cues or inspiration from these designs, [[original]] would be better suited.

h5. Analysts (purple)

* [[Architect (16personalities)|]] (INTJ)
* [[Logician (16personalities)|]] (INTP)
* [[Commander (16personalities)|]] (ENTJ)
* [[Debater (16personalities)|]] (ENTP)

h5. Diplomats (green)

* [[Advocate (16personalities)|]] (INFJ)
* [[Mediator (16personalities)|]] (INFP)
* [[Protagonist (16personalities)|]] (ENFJ)
* [[Campaigner (16personalities)|]] (ENFP)

h5. Sentinels (blue)

* [[Logistician (16personalities)|]] (ISTJ)
* [[Defender (16personalities)|]] (ISFJ)
* [[Executive (16personalities)|]] (ESTJ)
* [[Consul (16personalities)|]] (ESFJ)

h5. Explorers (yellow)

* [[Virtuoso (16personalities)|]] (ISTP)
* [[Adventurer (16personalities)|]] (ISFP)
* [[Entrepeneur (16personalities)|]] (ESTP)
* [[Entertainer (16personalities)|]] (ESFP)

title: shrieker_(armored_core)
body: An [[Armored Core]] [[mecha]] featured in the 2024 animated series [[Secret Level (series)|]]. Operated by an augmented pilot known as [b]The Pilot[/b], played by [[Keanu Reeves]], the SHRIEKER's design is a mixture of [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon|Balam's MELANDER frame]] with the [[armored core: for answer|Bernard and Felix Foundation's 063AN and the Omer TYPE-LAHIRE]]. The mech is infamous due to one scene in Secret Level where [spoilers]The Pilot kills an enemy pilot by using SHRIEKER's finger to kill the pilot in their cockpit[/spoilers].

body:
An unnamed Sarkaz dancer from the third [[Arknights]] Integrated Strategies, [i]Mizuki & Caerula Arbor[/i], or just "IS3".

She first appears in the encounter node "Dancing Chests" that triggers a battle, similar to those of:

* An unidentified Cautus's encounter node "Damsel in Distress" in IS1, [i]Ceobe's Fungimist[/i].
* [[Chained Sarkaz Girl]]'s encounter node "Shackled Bloodline" in IS2, [i]Crimson Solitaire[/i].

* [[Praying Sankta Nun (arknights)|]]'s encounter node "The Pious Worshiper" from IS5, [i]Sarkaz's Furnaceside Fables[/i].

Typically has [[red eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with a [u][[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]] seemingly tying a single [[ponytail]][/u] and [u][[pearl earrings]][/u] on her [[pointy ears]]. She wears [u][[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]][/u] and a [u][[long dress|long]][/u] [[see-through dress|see-through]] [[black dress]], from which a [[red tail|red]] [[demon tail]] comes out. Her [[black horns|black]] [[demon horns]] are [u]pointier[/u] and she is mostly depicted [u][[dancing]][/u].
[tn]To avoid misidentification with IS2's Chained Sarkaz Girl, the Dancing Lady's distinguished features have been underlined.[/tn]

title: sweet_potato
body:
Also called a camote, it is a type of tuber vegetable that isn't as starchy as the [[potato]], but instead has a sweeter taste. Tends to be mislabeled as a yam, but they are from an entirely different botanical species. This is also known as a food that makes you gassy. Hence why you see many artists draw [[fart]] illustrations as part of the gag.

In [[Mexico]], [[Bolivia]], [[Peru]], [[Chile]], Central America, and the [[Philippines]], the sweet potato is known as camote

Popularly associated with [[Aki Minoriko]] because she wears a sweet potato-scented perfume, and has a spellcard named after them in [[Mountain of Faith]].

[[Chiyoda_(kancolle)|Chiyoda]] of Kancolle fame is also pretty fond of them.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]
* [[roasted sweet potato]]
* [[sweet potato cake]]

title: adachi_tooru
body:
A character from [i][[Persona 4]][/i].

Adachi is a laid-back detective who works as an assistant to [[Doujima Ryoutarou]].

Adachi has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]]. He usually wears a [[business suit]] that consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with a [[red necktie]], [[black jacket]] with [[long sleeves]], [[brown belt]], [[black pants]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

Often seen buying [[cabbage]], which while not something he likes, eats because it is cheap.

title: celestia_(ange_vierge)
body:

title: dragon_li_cat
body:
The Dragon Li is a recently established Chinese breed of domestic [[cat]].

Dragon Li have ears that are relatively close together, medium in size, with broad ear roots and deep earlobes; wide cheeks; large and bright eyes, almond-shaped; brick-red nose with a nose line; moderate body size, wide and deep chest cavity; moderate length of limbs and tail, strong and muscular, with a strong sense of muscle; spotted forehead; black foot pads and paw hair; fur color is usually brown or dark brown, with some white fur on some Dragon Li cats' bodies. Because of its pure yellow striped pattern, it is also known as the yellow tabby cat or tiger-striped cat.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dragon Li":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragon_Li]

title: amiya_(arknights)
body:
[i]Amiya, leader of Rhodes Island, will fight alongside you.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

The public face and one of the top executives of Rhodes Island. Although she appears to be a young and inexperienced girl, she is universally trusted and highly qualified for her position. She is the first person the [[Doctor (Arknights)|]] sees when they wake up from their cryosleep at the beginning of the story.

She appear to be a young girl between the ages of 14-15 years old, with [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]]. She wears a [[blue ascot]], [[miniskirt]] and Rhodes Island [[Jacket]] in her official character design.

Her ears are meant to resemble those of a [[rabbit ears|rabbit]]. However, due to the way those ears are drawn, many fans joke that "she looks like a donkey":[/pools/18086]. 

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Kurosawa Tomoyo]].

h4. Profile

[expand]
"Doctor, I'm so glad that we're back together. And we'll walk this path together! I've got your back if you've got mine."
- Amiya

title: the_pose
body:
When a character [[lying|lies]] flat [[on stomach|on their stomach]] with their [[feet up]] in the air.

This is usually done to show off a character's [[breasts]], [[ass]], and [[feet]] all at the same time. The subject can be [[no shoes|wearing legwear]] or [[barefoot]], but their [[feet]] must be visible as this is a term coined by foot fetish enthusiasts to describe a particular pose that shows off the feet.

title: deformed
body:
Used if proportions of characters are deliberately simplified, making them look chibi-esque. This usually means that the body is proportional overall, unlike traditional chibis where the head appears bigger than or the same size as the body. 

For super deformed characters where the head is almost the same size as the body, use the [[chibi]] tag instead.

title: ange_vierge
body:
[b]Ange Vierge[/b] was a trading [[card game]], originally intended to serve as the core of a multimedia franchise. An animated adaptation aired Jul 10, 2016 to Sep 25, 2016. Development of the card game and wider property was discontinued in April of 2017, with the mobile title lingering until 2021.

One aspect to note is that Kadokawa, the franchise's publisher, held several card design contests over the course of the franchise's primary run. A number of the pieces from these contests are preserved on Danbooru, even when they were taken down from Pixiv and elsewhere.

title: sega_master_system
body:
The [b]SG-1000 Mark III[/b] (エスジー・セン [i]Esujī Sen III[/i]), also known as the [b]Sega Game 1000 Mark III[/b] or the [b]Sega Master System[/b], is a cartridge based [[video game]] home [[game_console|console]] manufactured by [[SEGA]] and first released in Japan, Australia, USA, Europe, Brazil and other countries in the mid 80s. 

The Master System was released in the USA in June 1986 and a year later in Japan as the [[Sega Mark III]]. It was a third-generation console produced as a redesign and improvement of a previous console called the [[Sega SG-1000 II]]. It was capable of using regular [[game cartridge]]s as well as smaller-sized Sega Cards which held less memory, but quickly became unpopular in favor of cartridges.

While having low sales in Japan and even less in the USA (and losing against the [[Nintendo]] [[Famicom]]/[[NES]] in those countries), the console proved extremely popular in Europe (with more than 6 million units purchased in the early 90s) and is still being sold in South America. 

[[Brazil]] is still the longest lasting market for the Master System. Tectoy, Sega's distributor in Brazil, is still responsible for marketing, sales and producing original games for it. Several different models of the console have been released in that country during the past decades. These are the Master System I, II, III (and a white colored relaunch version from the 2000s), the cordless Master System Compact, the pink Master System Girl, etc. All the existing [[Sega Game Gear]] games have been also ported to the system by Tectoy.

In 2009 and 2011, two variants of the Master System Evolution, a new console version successor to the Master System III that included 132 built-in games, were released only in Brazil. Another system called the Master System Portable which is a yellow gamepad with 30 built-in games has also been released recently by Tectoy.

The Sega Master System was succeded by the [[Sega Mega Drive]] in the early 80s.

h4.See also
* [[SEGA Light Phaser]]
* [[List of game consoles]]
* [[Tag Group:Video Game]]

h4.External links

* Wikipedia: "Master System":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Master_System

title: va-1ss
body:
A fictional transformable [[mecha]] from the [[MACROSS]] science fiction anime series. 

It first appeared in the [[Macross 2]] OVA from 1992.

The [b]VA-1SS Metal Siren[/b] is an advanced and very powerful combat-capable prototype [[variable fighter]]. 

It is armed with an experimental "EMP (Electro Magnetic Pulse) anti-capital ship device":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electromagnetic_pulse, missiles, and many energy weapons.

He was the founder of the Narumi Detective Agency and bearer of the Lost Driver and [[Kamen Rider Skull|Skull]] Memory. Though he was killed before the series begins, he remains a strong influence for Shoutarou and Philip.

title: mecha_hisui
body:
Mecha Hisui is a character from [[Melty Blood]], a spinoff of [[Tsukihime]].

Mecha Hisui is a robotic clone of [[Hisui (tsukihime)|]], created by [[Kohaku (tsukihime)|]] under the influence of the TATARI phenomenon. All mass-produced Mecha Hisui are designed to show complete subordination towards "Doctor" Kohaku.

As a robot, Mecha Hisui is designed with stereotypical anime robot qualities, including [[eye_beam|eye beams]], weapons hidden in her hands, being equipped with a [[jetpack]], and having attacks which reference famous robots from classic anime, such as [[god_gundam|God Gumdam]]'s [[shining_finger|Bakunetsu God Finger]]. 

A second Mecha Hisui, who is shown to be in the possession of [[Neco-arc]], was introduced in [i]Melty Blood: Actress Again[/i]. This Mecha Hisui has assumed control of it's personality, which results in showing highly rude interactions towards Neko-Arc.

She is voiced by [[Matsuki Miyu]].

h4. Official Art

title: julian_alfred_pankratz
body:
Mostly known by his poetic name Dandelion, Julian Alfred Pankratz, Viscount de Lettenhove, is a friend of [[Geralt of Rivia]] in [[the witcher (series)|the Witcher saga]]. A poet who has earned worldwide recognition, a skirt-chaser and a romantic.

In [[the Witcher 3]] game he narrates the events happening (or the events that already have happened) during the loading scenes.

Recognizable by his [[brown hair]], colorful and elegant purple attire and his [[lyre]].

An interesting thing about him is the fact that his name differs from one language to another (that is his nickname, not his real name):

English: Dandelion
Finnish: Valvati
Spansh, Polish, French, Portuguese, Romanian: Jaskier (Buttercup)
Russian: Лютик (Buttercup)
Etc.

title: helena_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [i]Helena[/i] (CL-50). Character design by [[Acea4]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and yellowish [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[military uniform]] which includes a [[neck ribbon]] in the design of the [[American flag]] with a [[star (symbol)|]] [[pin]], a [[black skirt]] with slits, a [[breastplate]]/[[corset]], [[grey thighhighs]] with [[striped thighhighs|stripes]] on the back, and [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] includes her 15 6-inch/47-caliber Mark 16 guns, six on each of her sides and three on top of her weapon, a modified [[Browning Auto 5]] [[shotgun]]. In her [[Helena Kai (kancolle)|Kai]] form her rigging is darker gray, her neck ribbon is changed to a mostly yellow one, her breastplate is removed, and the non-white stripes on her thighhighs are given more assorted colors.

title: chikuma_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Chikuma[/i]. Character design by [[Bob (biyonbiyon)|Bob]], voiced by [[Iguchi Yuka]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[green dress]], [[black belt]], [[single elbow glove|single]] [[brown gloves|brown]] [[elbow gloves|elbow glove]] on her left arm with an [[aircraft catapult]], [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] on her left leg, and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of all four of her historical 20.3 cm twin gun mounts on her right side (three on her thigh, one on her right shoulder), 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her left thigh, [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on her boots, and a seaplane cradle on her thighhigh.

Personality-wise, she is very, very obsessed with [[Tone (Kancolle)|]], mentioning her in nearly all of her lines and addressing her as nee-san.

title: inazuma_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Inazuma[/i], one of the five starter ships. Character design by [[Yadokari (Migihashi)|Yadokari]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[folded ponytail]]. The [i]Akatsuki[/i]-class wears a [[white shirt]] and dark [[blue sailor collar]], and [[black skirt]], with a "III" pin (symbolizing their stature as the third group of the Special Types) somewhere on themselves, and [[black socks]]. In her case, the "III" is on the lower right side of her shirt. 

A shy and innocent girl, she is also one of "the 5 starter ships":[/pools/9823] and is well known for her catchphrase "[[Nanodesu_(phrase)|]]!".

She also has a [[dark persona]] sometimes called [[Plasma-Chan_(Kancolle)|]]. This is a joke that originated in a comic (post #1917287) where an artist put his words of hatred for another artist named [[Nasu (tenpurakkusu)|]] (whose name means "[[eggplant]]"). Depending on the artist, Inazuma might slip back and forth into Plasma-chan in various ways, from being an irrational response to eggplants, to being "Inazuma's serious side", to simply being an always-psychotic character among some artists with darker proclivities.

h4. Appearance

title: mogami_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Mogami[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[swept bangs]], [[grey eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit is shared with her sister [i]Mikuma[/i]: a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[red shirt|red]] [[sailor shirt]] with a dark [[red sailor collar]], [[brown shorts]], [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and black [[lace-up boots]].  

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast to her back, four (or three at kai) 20.3 cm twin gun mounts, and a [[flight deck]] at kai form. She gains two [[radar]] sets at kai form as well. 

She is a frank, upbeat, energetic, and [[tomboy]]ish girl. Due to having collided three times in her historic service, she's commonly portrayed as quite clumsy, and too eager to watch where she's going. Collisions with her sister-ship [[Mikuma (Kancolle)|]] are most commonly portrayed. Because of her boyish looks, she is often portrayed as the target of rumors of being a boy, or outright portrayed as one.

title: mikura_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Mikura[/i]. Character design by [[Acea4]], voiced by [[Uchida Shuu]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[grey hair]] done in [[low twintails]], and [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[white_shirt|white]] [[sailor shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and [[blue sailor collar]], knotwork tie, white [[undershirt]], [[red_skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[hip vent]]s, [[white hat|white]] [[sailor hat]], [[white gloves]], [[white socks]], and a dolphin pin on her collar, referring to her namesake island's dolphins (she thus joins Taigei's club of wearing cetacean-shaped pins). 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her real-life funnel and masts to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, [[depth charge]]s on her [[brown belt]] and [[thigh strap]], and [[paravane]]s on her ankles.

She is often nicknamed "Okra" due to alternate kanji readings (The "Mi" in "Mikura" can also be read as "O"), even by her artist.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3613038: Base
* !post #3808388: [[mikura_(mitsukoshi)_(kancolle)|Mitsukoshi]] collab

title: jacqueline_(eversoul)
body:
An Undead-type Soul from the mobile game [[Eversoul]].
CV: Lee Bo-hee (Korean) | Moriya Kyouka (Japanese)
[hr]
An artificial Soul, much like [[Mephistopheles (Eversoul)|]], discovered by the [[Savior (Eversoul)|]] and his party while exploring the Forgotten Ruins. She was tasked by Dr. Faust to guard whatever secrets she's hidden within these ruins, [spoilers]which also doubles as a resting place for her former master Cu Chulainn[/spoilers]. After [spoilers][[Linzy (Eversoul)|]]'s "death"[/spoilers], she became a ward of Tabria under the noblewoman [[Rebecca (Eversoul)|]] and is working on acclimating to modern society.

Her associated Artifact is the [i]"Gáe Bulg":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G%C3%A1e_Bulg[/i].

title: genderswap_(otf)
body:
Subset of [[genderswap]] where a character who is normally [[1other|sexless]], [[androgynous]], or [[ambiguous gender|ambiguous]] is instead depicted as female. This is usually indicated by the presence of [[breasts]] and/or [[pussy]].

Simply wearing a feminine outfit is not enough to qualify for this tag, unless the lower portion is tight enough to unambiguously show the absence of a [[bulge]].

Often used on characters from media like [[Houseki no Kuni]] and [[Len'en]], as well as individual characters like the [[Pyro (tf2)|]], [[Frisk (undertale)|]] and [[Chara (undertale)|]].

title: gumi
body:
GUMI is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Internet Co., Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. 

Licensed as Megpoid (メグッポイド), she is voiced by seiyuu [[Nakajima Megumi]]. Her appearances were initially illustrated by [[Yuuki Masami]], and later by [[nou (nounknown)]]. She wears a two piece outfit consisting of a [[crop top]] and [[frilled skirt]]. Her accessories are white [[wrist cuffs]], [[choker]], and [[boots]]. Around her leg is a red [[frilled thigh strap]], and she wears a gray [[headset]] that has red [[goggles]] attached.

Her orange and green design resulted in her character item being a [[carrot]].

She has received updated voicebanks for VOCALOID3, VOCALOID4, VOCALOID6, [[A.I. VOICE]], and [[Synthesizer V]].

h4. Official art

title: yuki_miku_(2017)
body:
"Twinkle Snow ver."

The 2017 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme for the 2017 design contest was "Stars/constellations of winter Hokkaido", with the winning design by [[Nishina hima]].

Her fan nickname is "Twinkle-chan".

She has blue hair bows with [[stars|star hair ornaments]], a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[blue dress]] decorated with [[constellation print]], blue [[detached sleeves]], and mostly bare legs with a [[frilled thigh strap]]. She wields a [[conductor baton|music baton]] that acts as a magical [[wand]].

Her theme song is [[Star_Night_Snow_(Vocaloid)|Star Night Show]] by Orangestar and nbuna.

title: mint_fantome_(minto_2.0)
body:
The current default costume of the [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Mint Fantome]], replacing her [[Mint Fantome (minto 1.0)|old design]] from March 2021 onwards. It was originally illustrated by [[kgr]], with the design finalized by [[Ichika Maia (artist)|]]. On Halloween 2024, she debuted an update, illustrated by [[Ayamy]], which she refers to as her 3.0 model.

It's a [[maid]] outfit consisting of a [[triangular headpiece]], a [[maid headdress]], a [[green dress|green]]/[[aqua dress|aqua]] [[vertical-striped dress|vertical-stripped]] [[backless dress|backless]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[center frills]] and a [[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]] [[skirt under dress|under it]], [[aqua sleeves|aqua]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]] with a [[large bow|large]] [[black bow]], [[uneven legwear]] (a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[white thighhighs|white]] [[frilled thighhighs|frilled thighhigh]] with a [[black garter straps|black garter strap]] and a [[white socks|white]] [[bobby socks|bobby sock]]) and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]].

Some of the differences between the 2.0 and the 3.0 version are that she wears a [[leotard under clothes|leotard]] under her dress in the 2.0 version, while she wears normal underwear on the 3.0 version, the length of her sleeves is also different, which go [[sleeves past fingers|past her fingers]] on her 2.0 model but only [[sleeves past wrists|sleeves past her wrists]] on the 3.0 version, also the bridal [[frilled thigh strap]] from her 2.0 version is replaced with a blue [[thigh strap]] with a [[heart-shaped buckle]], and she also has [[pointy ears]] on 3.0.

She has an [[alternate color]] version called Lilac where magenta-purple replaces the white-green.
